definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: Butter lamps, together with the numerous pre-Buddhist worship.
sentences.chinese: 连同无数的酥油灯供奉佛前。

sentences.english: Small niches line the walkway and are illuminated by diyas (small lamps) in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 小壁龛沿走道排布，晚上被小油灯照亮。

sentences.english: So far we've been relying on our little and a dozen kerosene lamps.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止，我们还是靠十几个小小的煤油灯照明。

sentences.english: With a flash, the kerosene lamp went out.
Because it burns brightly, it is used for illumination; countless homes are still illuminated with oil-burning lamps.
sentences.chinese: 石油的燃烧亮度高，很多人家里还在用油灯。

sentences.english: As night fell, work went on by oil lamp and candlelight.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临时，僧侣们点起油灯和蜡烛，继续干活。

sentences.english: Before electric light was invented, this oil was mostly used for burning in oil lamps.
sentences.chinese: 在电灯未发明之前，这种油脂大部份使用于点燃油灯。

sentences.english: The light came from a taper which was burning in one corner.
sentences.chinese: 光是从墙角上的一盏油灯里发出来的。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly the fault knocks a mistake to bump of dropped to in the fuel bulb, the cloth is flamed a hole.
sentences.chinese: 没想到误打误撞的就掉到了油灯上，布料被烧了个洞。

sentences.english: The kerosene lamps that succeeded them are dramatically different in design.
sentences.chinese: 设计形式完全不同的煤油灯替代了它们。

sentences.english: Grace satIn her little room, writing a letter by the light of an oil lamp.
sentences.chinese: 格雷丝坐在她的小房间里，在油灯下写信。

sentences.english: I had bought it weeks before, for an oil lamp I had before I sold my things.
sentences.chinese: 我三星期前买来点油灯用的，在我卖掉东西之前。

sentences.english: A lamp exploded in one of them near the shore and the fire speedily spread.
sentences.chinese: 其中一条靠岸的船上的油灯爆炸，火势迅速蔓延。

sentences.english: The oil lamp sizzled softly on his table.
sentences.chinese: 油灯在他桌上发出轻微的嗞嗞声。

sentences.english: The refined kerosene could be used in lamps, replacing the more expensive whale oil.
sentences.chinese: 精制的煤油可用于油灯，替代了更昂贵的鲸油。

sentences.english: The lamp has smoked the wall.
sentences.chinese: 那盏油灯把墙壁熏黑了。

definition: altar lamp burning day and night
candle light/candle-lit (vigil etc)/candela, unit of luminous intensity (cd)
fire and candles/household things that burn
